subject: Re: [junit] Each data unit that is loaded from XML file can be executed in each method respectively?
msgSnippet: Have you looked at the @RunWith(Parameters.class) feature in JUnit 4? David Saff
messageBody:
Have you looked at the @RunWith(Parameters.class) feature in JUnit 4?

David Saff

2008/11/30 王凌华 <mmchut.wang@...>:
> Yang,
>
> Thanks for your feedback.
>
> What I have done - - - - - -
>
> Target class to test:
> public class Target {
> public static boolean checkSomething(String para1,String para2,String para3)
> {
> //Some logics here.
> }
>
> Test class:
> public class TestTarget {
> ...
> public static List<String[]> *paraList* = new ArrayList<String[]>()* *;
> //Each line, each String array.
> @Test public void testCheckSomething() {
> // for loop *paraList*
>
> for(String[] para:*paraList*) {
> boolean result =Target.checkSomething(para[0],para[1],para[2]);
> AssertEquals(result,Boolean.valueOf(para[3]).booleanValue());
> }
> }
>
> @BeforeClass public void readTestData {
> // Read Test Data from XML, Text, or csv file. Each line has four columns,
> one,two and three columns will be passed para1,para2,para3 of
> Target.checkSomething method, the last one is the expect result.
> }
> ...
> }
>
> A bunch of tests will be executed, is not it? Seem that sometimes it is not
> a easy thing to locate which cases has been failed if failture encountered.
> Is there any way to improve JUnit design for this case here? Any suggestion
> would be appriciated.
>
> Thanks.
>
